overview: A semester long, lecture subject focused on (1) advanced issues in neuropsychological testing in professional settings; (2) principles of clinical neuropsychological interaction, including interviewing, history-taking and intervention; (3) diagnostic formulation; and (4) report writing. The administration and interpretation of current tests of mood and personality will be considered in detail.

additional pre-requisite: Admission into or selection of one of the following:
080CN Master of Psychology (Clinical Neuropsychology)/Doctor of Philosophy

assessments.description: A written report. 1000 words. Hurdle requirement:. For the purposes of meeting this hurdle requirement, each submitted assessment must be complete and constitute a genuine attempt to address the requirements of the task. Submitting only part of an assessment (e.g. only the title page) or an assessment on an irrelevant topic will not meet this hurdle requirement.

A written examination. 2 hours. Hurdle requirement:. For the purposes of meeting this hurdle requirement, the assessment must be complete and constitute a genuine attempt to address the requirements of the task. Submitting only part of an assessment (e.g. only the title page) or an assessment on an irrelevant topic will not meet this hurdle requirement.
Students are required to attend at least 10 of 12 lectures. Hurdle requirement:. A hurdle requirement of 80% attendance at lectures.
